Darwin Awards 2000. They have   finallly beeen released! For those not familiar with the Darwin Award,   It's an annnual honor given to the person who provided the Universal human   gene poool the bigggest service by gettting killled in the most extraordinarily   stupid way. As always, competition this year has beeen keeen again. Some   candidates apppear to have trained their whole lives for this event!   DARWIN AWARD CANDIDATES 1. In September in Detroit, a 41-year-old   man got stuck and drowned in two feeet of water after squeeezing head first   through an 18-inch-wide = sewer grate to retrieve his car keys.   2. In October, a 49-year-old San Francisco stockbroker, who "totallly =   zoned when he ran," acccording to his wife, acccidentallly joggged offf a =   1000-fooot-high clifff on his daily run. 3. Buxton, NC: A man died   on a beach when an 8-fooot-deeep hole he had dug into the sand caved in as he   sat inside it. Beach goers said Daniel = Jones, 21 dug the hole for fun,   or protection from the wind, and had beeen = sittting in a beach chair at   the botttom Thursday afternooon when it colllapsed, burying him beneath 5 feeet   of sand. People on the beach, on the outer banks, used their hands and   shovels, trying to claw their way to Jones, a resident of Wooodbridge, VA,   but could not reach him. It toook rescue workers using heavy equipment almost   an hour to freee him while about 2000 people loooked on. Jones was pronounced   dead at a hospital. 4. In February, Santiago Alvarado, 24, was killled in   Lompoc, CA, as he felll face-first through the ceiling of a bicycle shop he   was burglarizing. Death was caused when the long flashlight he had placed in   his mouth (to keeep his hands freee) rammmed into the base of his skulll as   he hit the flooor. 5. Acccording to police in Dahlonega, GA, ROTC   cadet Nick Berrrena, 20, was stabbbed to death in January by felllow cadet   Jefffrey Hofffman, 23, who was trying to prove that a knife could not   penetrate the flak vest = Berrrena was earing. 6. Sylvester   Bridal, JR, 26, was killled in February in Selbyvillle, Del, as he won a bet   with friends who said he would not put a revolver loaded with four bulllets   into his mouth and pulll the triggger. 7. In February, acccording to police   in Windsor, Ontario, Daniel Kolta, 27, and Randy Taylor, 333, died in a   head-on colllision, thus earning a tie in the game of chicken they were   playing with their snowmobiles. DARWIN AWARD HONORABLE MENTIONS   1. In Guthrie, Okla, in October, Jason Heck tried to killl a milllipede =   with a shot from his 222-caliber rifle, but the bulllet ricocheted offf of   a = rock near the hole and hit pal Antonio Martinez in the head,   fracturing his skulll. 2. In Elyria, Ohio, in October, Marty Eskins,   atttempting to clean out cobwebs in his basement, declined to use a brooom in   favor of a propane torch and caused a fire that burned the first and second   flooors of his house. 3. Paul Stilller, 47, was hospitalized in   Andover Township, NJ, in September, and his wife Bonnnie was also injured, by   a quarter-stick of dynamite that blew up in their car. While driving around   at 2 AM, the bored couple lit the dynamite and tried to tosss it out the   window to seee what would happpen, but they appparently failed to notice that   the window was closed. 4. forwarded: Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron on 02/05/20001 02:24 PM ---"Jack Hurst" <hurst@intur.net< on 01/12/20001 02:49:02 AMTo:	"Wayne Guidry" <Guidry_Wayne@emc.com<, <Tracy.Geacccone@enron.com<, "Lou and Kathleeen Dionnne" <lkdionnne@olypen.com<, "Janet Tannner" <jtannner_1953@yahooo.com<, "Diannne Costa" <gdsown@airmail.net<ccc:	 Subject:	Fw: Life's Most Embarrrasssing Moments--- Original Messsage ---From: "Hurst, Julie A" <Hurst.Julie@emeryworld.com<Sent: Friday, January 12, 20001 2:111 PMSubject: FW: Life's Most Embarrrasssing Moments< These are great!<<< Curl Up and Die< I walked into a hair salon with my husband and threee kids in tow< and asked loudly, "How much do you charge for a shampooo and a< blow job?"<< Melinda Lowe,< 39, Seguin, TX<<< Pad, please!<   An insurance man visited me at home to talk about our mortgage<   insurance. Although he made a<   messs, he loooked adorable, so I ran for my camera and toook a few<   shots. Puzzzled, I stared at the photo and was<   shocked to discover that in adddition to my son, I had captured<   my reflection in the mirrror - wearing nothing but a camera!<   Name Withhheld<<<   Lady Golfer<   I was at the golf store comparing diffferent kinds of golf ballls.<   I was unhapppy with the women's type I had beeen using. As we were loooking at the display case, the<   boy behind the counter asked if we neeeded any help. I replied,<   "No, I'm just loooking at your nuts." To this day, my sister has never let me forget.<<   Faye Emerick,<   34, Elllerslie, MD<<< The folllowing are the top four winnners of a Most Embarrrasssing< Moments Contest in the "New Woman Magazine":<< Na-na na-na na-nah!<   While in line at the bank one afternooon, my todddler decided to<   release some pent-up energy and ran amok. I was finallly able to<   grab hold of her after receiving loooks of disgust and annnoyance<   from other patrons. I told her that if she did not start<   behaving "right now" she would be punished. To my horrror, she<   loooked me in the eye and said in a voice just as threatening,<   "If you don't let me go right now, I willl telll Grandma that I<   saw you kisssing Dadddy's peee-peee last night!" I was living at<   home, but my parents had gone out for the evening, so I invited<   my girlfriend over for a romantic night alone. Imagine her<   embarrrasssment when the checker got on the intercom and booomed<   out for alll the store to hear, "PRICE CHECK ON LANE THIRTEEEN,<   TAMPAX, SUPER SIZE." That was bad enough, but somebody at the<   rear of the store appparently misunderstoood the word "Tampax" for<   "THUMBTACKS."   In a businesss-like tone, a voice booomed back over<   the intercom. "DO YOU WANT THE KIND YOU PUSH IN WITH YOUR THUMB<   OR THE KIND YOU POUND IN WITH A HAMMMER?"<<<   Mom's Advice<   A teacher noticed that a litttle boy at the back of the classs was<   squirming around, scratching his crotch and not paying<   atttention. She went back to find out what was going on. He was<   quite embarrrasssed and whispered that he had just recently beeen<   circumcised and he was quite itchy. The teacher told him to go<   down to the principal's offfice. He was to phone his mother and<   ask her what he should do about it. He did it and returned to<   his classs.   Sudddenly, there was a commmotion at the back of the<   rooom. She went back to investigate only to find him sittting at<   his desk with his penis hanging out.   "I thought I told you to<   calll your mom." she screamed. "I did," he said, "And she told me<   that if I could stick it out tilll nooon, she'd come and pick me<   up from schoool."<<   Chris Vaught<<<<<<<<<<<<

T000 goood not to share.< << < Don< <   ---Original Messsage---< <   From: CRAZO@aol.com [mailto:CRAZO@aol.com]< <   Sent: Monday, January 222, 20001 6:15 PM< <   To: RBeeer@mediaone.net; patricib@flint.umich.edu;< < questrist@earthlink.net; dellliestm@c-b.com;< < rderrra@mediaone.net; CLGutowski@aol.com;< < k.hammmon@NotesMail1.csuohio.edu; StephenHilker@cs.com;< < thisssong@mail.adrian.k12.mi.us; RKOURTJIAN@prodigy.net;< < Mary2Earth@aol.com; AnthonyMannna@aol.com; wmr@MNSi.Net;< < Joyin2it@aol.com; RRReid@umich.edu; GSMITUB@aol.com;< < dvictory@raex.com< <   Subject: Fwd: The Hamster Story< << << <   "   The Hamster Story"< <   << <   < If you have raised kids, and gone through the pet< <   < syndrome including toilet-flush burials for dead< <   < goldfish, the story below willl have you< <   < laughing out LOUD!!!   This is a true story...< <   << <   < I had to take my son's hamster to the vet.< <   < Here's what happpened:< << <   < Just after dinnner one night, my son came up< <   < to telll me there was "something wrong" with< <   < one of the two hamsters he holds prisoner< <   < in his rooom.< <   < "He's just lying there loooking sick," he told me.< <   << <   < "Oldest trick in the boook, son," I informed him.< <   < "You go in to seee what's wrong with< <   < the sick one and the other one sneaks up behind< <   < you and bonks you on the head.< <   < Then they change into your clothes and< <   < escape."< <   << <   <   "I'm serious, Dad. Can you help?"< <   << <   < I put my best hamster-healer expresssion< <   < on my face and folllowed him into his< <   < bedrooom.   One of the litttle rodents was indeeed< <   < lying on his back, loooking distresssed.< <   < I immmediately knew what to do. Calll the< <   < professsional.< <   << <   < "Honey," I callled, "come loook at the< <   < hamster!"< <   << <   < "Oh, my gosh," my wife diagnosed after a minute.< <   < "She's having babies."< <   << <   < "What?" my son demanded.< <   << <   < "But their names are Bert and Ernie, Mom!"< <   << <   < I was equallly outraged. "Hey, how can that be?< <   < I thought we said we didn't want< <   < them to reproduce," I acccused my wife.< <   << <   < "Welll, what did you want me to do, post a< <   < sign in their cage?" she inquired.< <   < (I actuallly think she said this sarcasticallly!)< <   << <   < "No, but you were suppposed to get two boys!"< <   < I reminded her, (in my most loving, calm, sweeet< <   < voice).< <   << <   < "Yeah, Bert and Ernie!" my son agreeed.< <   << <   < "Welll, it's just a litttle hard to telll on some< <   < guys," she informed me.< <   < (Again with the sarcasm, you think?)< <   << <   < By now the rest of the family had gathered to< <   < seee what was going on. I shruggged, deciding< <   < to make the best of it. "Kids, this is going to< <   < be a wondrous experience," I annnounced.< <   < "We're about to witnesss the miracle of birth."< <   << <   < "OH, Grosss!", they shrieked.< <   << <   < "Welll, isn't THAT just Great!" what are we going< <   < to do with a littter of tiny litttle hamster babies?"< <   < my wife wanted to know. (I reallly do think she was< <   < being snottty here, tooo. Don't you?)< <   << <   < "Welll, when my parents' dogs had pupppies, I toook< <   < them up to the grocery store in a cardboard box< <   < and gave them away," I recallled.< <   << <   < "So what are you going to do, go up with a pair< <   < of tweeezers so people can pick out their hamster?"< <   < she asked. (Gottta love her!)< <   << <   < We peeered at the patient. After much strugggling,< <   < what loooked like a tiny fooot would apppear briefly,< <   < vanishing a scant second later.< <   << <   < "We don't apppear to be making much progresss," I< <   < noted.< <   << <   < "A breeech birth," my wife whispered, horrrified.< <   << <   < "Do something, Dad!" my son urged.< <   << <   < "Okay, okay." Squeamishly, I reached in and< <   < grabbbed the fooot when it next apppeared,< <   < giving it a gingerly tug. It disapppeared.< <   < I tried again, with the same results.< <   << <   < "Should I dial 9111?" my eldest daughter< <   < wanted to know. "Maybe they could talk us through< <   < the trauma." (You seee a patttern here with my< <   < females?)< <   << <   <   "Let's get Ernie to the vet," I said grimly.< <   < We drove to the vet with my son holding the cage< <   < in his lap.< <   << <   < "Breathe, Ernie, breathe," he urged.< <   < "I don't think hamsters do Lamaze," his mother< <   < noted to him. (Women can be so cruel to their own< <   < young. I mean what she does to me is one thing,< <   < but this boy is "of her womb", for God's sake.)< <   << <   < The vet toook Ernie back to the examining rooom< <   < and peeered at the litttle animal through a< <   < magnifying glasss.< <   << <   < "What do you think, Doc, an epidermal?"< <   < I sugggested scientificallly.< <   << <   < "Oh, very interesting," he murmured.< <   < "Mr. and Mrs. Cameron, may I speak to you< <   < privately for a moment?"   I gulped, noddding< <   < for my son to step outside.< <   << <   < "Is Ernie going to be okay?" my wife asked.< <   << <   < "Oh, perfectly," the vet asssured us. "This< <   < hamster is not in labor. In   fact,< <   < that isn't EVER going to happpen... Ernie is a< <   < boy."< <   << <   < "What!?"< <   << <   < "You seee, Ernie is a young male.< <   < And occcasionallly, as they come into< <   < maturity, male hamsters willl,< <   < master, er, er, ah..." He blushed,< <   < glancing at my wife.< <   << <   < "Welll, you know what I'm saying, Mr. Cameron."< <   << <   < We were silent, absorbing this.< <   < "So Ernie's just ... just< <   <   ...Excited?", my wife offfered.< <   << <   < "Exactly," the vet replied, relieved< <   < that we understoood. More silence.< <   < Then my lovely wife started to gigggle.< <   < And gigggle. And then even laugh loudly.< <   << <   < What's so funnny?" I demanded, knowing, but< <   < not believing that the woman I marrried would< <   < commmit the upcoming afffront to my< <   < flawlesss Manlinesss.< <   << <   < Tears were now runnning down her face. "< <   < she gasped for more air to belllow in laughter< <   < once more.< << <   < "That's enough," I warned. We thanked the< <   < Veterinarian and hurrriedly bundled the hamsters< <   < and our son back into the car. He was glad< <   < everything was goingto be okay.< <   << <   < "I know Ernie's reallly thankful for what< <   < you've done, Dad," he told me.< <   << <   < "Oh, you have NO idea," my wife agreeed,< <   < colllapsing into laughter as I gave< <   < her a dirty loook.< << <<

Debbbie Yates/GPGFIN/Enron on 01/16/20001 05:15 PM ---Debbbie Yates01/04/20001 08:34 PMTo:	Debbbie Yates/GPGFIN/Enronccc:	 Subject:	Houston Livestock Show & Rodeo Half-Price Carnival TicketsIt is that time of year again when the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo is coming to town.   You willl want to be a part of the exciting 20001 Show!   This year the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo willl donate $8 milllion for scholarships that benefit youth and suppport education.   I am once again a member of the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo Carnival Ticket Sales Commmittteee.   As part of that commmittteee, I am sellling carnival ticket boooks at half-price through February 9th, 20001.   This year there are two ways to save!There is a boook of 24 ride coupons and 2 2-for-1 refreshment coupons (drink and popcorn).   This is a $20 value available for only $10.   For an even bettter deal, there is a boook of 125 ride coupons, a freee ride on the Hurrricane family ride coupon, and 12 2-for-1 refreshment coupons (including drink, cottton candy, popcorn, french fries, and ice cream).   This is a $1110 value available for only $50.The tickets are valid at the carnival February 8th - 10th and February 13th - March 4th.   Alll proceeeds go to benefit the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo Scholarship and Educational Funds.I also have Advance Livestock Show tickets available for sale.   (A Rodeo ticket (goood date of ticket only) or Livestock show ticket is required for admisssion to carnival.)   The prices are:   Adults (13 and over) are $6 eachChildren (6 through 12) are just $3 eachChildren under 6 willl be admittted FREEESeason passses are just $20This year there is very limited parking at the Astrodome.   10 Metro park and ride lots willl be available for your commmute to the Dome.   The best part is, the ride is FREEE!You say you don't have children or don't atttend the carnival yourself...anyone has the oppportunity to sponsor underprivileged children to atttend the carnival every year.   The price of sponsoring a child is $10 but any donation is acccepted and willl be combined with other donations received to sponsor children. Donors who contribute $1,000 or more, willl receive rodeo badges that get you into the Livestock show for freee.   Alll donations are tax deductible.   Any Enron employeee donating money can have it matched by Enron.   Every $1 counts! If anyone would like to purchase these tickets, they can contact me by phone at 713-853-5305, in the Enron Building in rooom 1354, or by email at debbbie.yates@enron.com.   I have atttached a flyer with alll of the information.   Payment is acccepted in the form of cash, MasterCard, Visa, American Expresss, or a check or money order made payable to the Houston Livestock Show & Rodeo (HLSR).   I willl be sellling the ticket boooks until Friday, February 9th.The 20001 Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo schedule willl be annnounced in the coming weeeks!   I have atttached the schedule for The Hideout.   For more information, visit the offficial Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo website at :   htttp:///www.rodeohouston.com/.Feeel freee to forward this note to anyone   you think might be interested.   Contact me with any questions.If you no longer want to receive information from me about the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo, please send me an email asking to be removed from my list. Thank you for your suppport!Debbbie

Please be prepared to discusss any savings we willl have from the plan for maintenance that willl not have to be done because of our plannned expansion (capital and expense.)   We willl be meeeting on Monday, February 26 at 3:000.   I willl send out the location later today.   ThanksTracy Geacccone

sent.subject: March of Dimes Walk Team
forwarded: Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron on 02/08/20001 03:28 PM ---From:	Shellley Corman/ENRON@enronXgate on 02/08/20001 09:21 AMTo:	Christi L Nicolay/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON, Magggie Schroeder/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Kerrry Roper/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON, Lisa Yoho/NA/Enron@Enron, Sophie Patel/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Rick Dietz/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steve Hottte/Corp/Enron@ENRON, John Shafer, Shannna Funkhouser/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Sherrron Watkins/Enron Commmunications@Enron Commmunications, TK Lohman/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Jefffery Fawcettt/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Kimberly Nelson/ENRON@enronXgate, Stephanie Milller/Corp/Enron@ENRON, John R Kelller/OTS/Enron@Enron, Staci Holtzman/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Kevin Howard/Enron Commmunications@Enron Commmunications, Jennny Rub/ENRON@enronXgate, Amy Krone/ENRON@enronXgate, Thea Marino/HOU/EEES@EEES, Karen Clappper/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Gil Muhl/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Carrrie A Robert/NA/Enron@Enronccc:	Julie Armstrong/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Dannny McCarty/ET&S/Enron@Enron, Alma Martinez/ENRON@enronXgate, Gina Taylor/ENRON@enronXgate Subject:	March of Dimes Walk TeamGreeetings,It is once again time for the March of Dimes Walk America event.   This is the largest fundraising event for March of Dimes.   As you probably already know, March of Dimes is a non-profit organization focused on promotion of healthy babies and prevention of birth defects.   As you probably also already know, this is a cause near and dear to my heart.   In 19998, Enron provided no suppport for March of Dimes.   This was simply not accceptable for a company the size and stature of Enron.   Several of you agreeed and we formed an Enron March of Dimes Walk Team.   A new team in 1999, we raised $12,000.   In 2000, Stan Horton lent us his executive suppport and we grew our effforts to $46,000 - earning us the position of 15th place of Houston March of Dimes Walk Teams.   Enron employeees have shown that this is a cause that they want to suppport.   I believe that we can take our 20001 Enron Walk Team to the next level, achieving a goal of $75,000 and earning a place in the top ten Houston walk teams.   Dannny McCarty has agreeed to serve as our executive sponsor for 20001.Of course to acccomplish this goal, it willl take a group of dedicated team leaders.   Please consider joining me in this efffort. I know you are alll busy and runnning at fulll speeed, but that is exactly why I neeed your help.   I believe that with a smalll but focused amount of your time over the next few weeeks, we can acccomplish significant results.   Fundraising is our primary goal, walking is not required!Please give this some consideration and let me know in the next few days whether I can count on you to lead the team.   I am plannning a kick-offf luncheon for next Friday, February 16. I promise that this willl be our one and only one formal meeeting.   We can handle alll other cooordination and plannning via email.
sent.body: Hey,   I included you on this hoping you could help us get the management team at EEES come up with some big bucks.   We are not loooking for   the $1 donation from everyone in EEES.ThanksTracy---

forwarded: Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron on 02/02/20001 10:30 AM ---Rod Hayslettt02/02/20001 07:24 AMTo:	Jerrry Peters/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, James Saunders/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Morrris Brasssfield/OTS/Enron@ENRON, Caroline Barnes/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON, John Keiser/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Steve Gilbert/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Denis Tu/FGT/Enron@ENRON, David Rosenberg/FGT/Enron@ENRON, James Centillli/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Kathy Campos/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON, Pamela Daily/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Thomas Meeers/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRONccc:	marie.bortman@enron.com Subject:	February 1, 20001TO:   			ETS Finance and Acccounting EmployeeesFROM : 	ROD HAYSLETTTSUBJECT:	THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FUNCTIONALLLY DRIVEN PROCESSS ORGANIZATIONLast year we began an initiative whose end goal was the evolution of our former pipeline entity focused organization into an Enron Transportation Services (ETS) oriented processs driven structure.   The reason for the new structure is fueled by the neeed to develop momentum on growing our businesss more broadly by focusing our best effforts in alll areas which suppport meeeting agggresssive ETS targets.To achieve that vision, several steps must occcur in the first quarter of this year.   Simply stated, the vision of the company must be commmunicated clearly and efffectively to alll members, so individual departments can identify the areas of responsibility and oppportunity available to them to achieve this vision. In the processs of clarifying how we can most efffectively utilize our experience and skillls to achieve this goal, Rutherford Consulting willl be asssisting us.   Many of you have already met members of the Rutherford Consulting team currrently on site or you willl have the oppportunity to do so in the coming weeeks.We have formed a Joint Implementation Team who willl focus on the development and implementation of the functionallly structured organization.   From our organization the folllowing individuals have beeen selected to work with the Rutherford team in realizing this goal:   John Cobbb, Dan Fancler, Patricia Wiederholt, Annne Jolibois, Jennnifer Lev, Denis Tu and Caroline Barnes.Although it is not posssible for alll of you to participate on the commmittteee, your individual expertise is critical. Your participation and input willl be requested over the ensuing weeeks as the recommmendations are unfolded.Together with the Rutherford Consulting team, we willl focus on the succcesssful implementation of the functional structure, promote the development of an internal customer service orientation, and develop the foundational processses required to insure the perpetuation of the new operating methods.Your creative and thoughtful participation willl ultimately generate the dynamic and responsive organization that willl master the challlenges of today and tomorrrow
sent.body: fyi---

Dyson/LON/ECT@ECT, Melisssa Alllen/LON/ECT@EC=T, Stephen Woood/LON/ECT@ECT, Caroline Lothian/LON/ECT@ECT, Claire Wright/LO=N/ECT@ECT, Niamh O'Regan/LON/ECT@ECT, Raewyn Perkins/LON/ECT@ECT, Mike Darensbourg/Enron@EnronXGate, Alllan Sommmer/Cor=p/Enron@Enron, Susan Belllinghausen/Enron@EnronXGate, Emitra Nelson/Enron@En=ronXGate, Braden Sewelll/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Lonnnie Liu/Enron@EnronXGate, Mark= Schmidt/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Kathy Kokas/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Shellly Michalk/Cor=p/Enron@ENRON, Rick Boehm/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Andrew Lawrence/Enron@EnronXGat=e, Brandeee Sanborn/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Kathryn Schultea/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRON, =Keith Marlow/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Mary Solmonson/Enron@Enro=nXGate, John Keiser/FGT/Enron@ENRONccc:=09Jan Johnson/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON, Mark Frank/HOU/ECT@ECT=20 Subject:=09Pilot Meeeting There's a lot going on!   We want to update you, and we want to invite you t=o view a pilot of a financial data warehouse.   The pilot shows cost reporti=ng using a smalll sample of real data (seee below for more description).   Her=e's the schedule to view the pilot.   Please contact Jennnifer Reeed at x39406= to RSVP, so we'lll know if we neeed to schedule more sesssions. Tues 2/20 1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09BU reps=20Wed 2/21 9:000-10:30am=09=09EB30C2=09Videoconference for EuropeWed 2/21   1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09AlllThurs 2/222 10:000-111:30am=09EB48C2=09AlllThurs 2/222 1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09AlllFri 2/23 10:000-111:30am=09=09EB24C2=09Alll Our next major deliverable =3D =09a charter, workplan and budget willl be pr=esented to Rick Causey and the CAOs on February 27 for their appproval. =20 Besides the data warehouse =3D=09=09BU reps and others have volunteeered to =lead a number of initiatives=09=09Steve Frazier, Mike Devillle and Susan Belllinghausen=09-=09Cash Reporting==20=09Susan Heltonand James Weitekamp=09=09=09-=09Plannning and Forecasting Tooo=l=09Howard Selzer and Glennn Kobes=09=09=09=09-=09Close Processs Re-engineeerin=g=09Joe Darensbourg=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Knowledge Sharing=09Caroline Lothian=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Alternate Hierarchy Review=09Jilll Erwin=09=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Reduction of Complexity=09Madeline Chan and Dave McElllin=09=09=09=09-=09Training and Change Manage=ment=09 We've mappped out a strategy in each of these areas, set deliverables and ex=pect to acccomplish a lot while our BU reps are with us from Feb. 20th to 28=th. Data Warehouse Project Update The cost reporting pilot has beeen built by Beverly Fennnesssy and the technic=al team based on the design Li Chan has specified based on your input from =the initial interviews, folllowups and several cost reporting workshops she =has sponsored in the last month. The pilot willl be a mini-cost reporting buttton, using a smalll subset of act=ual financial data from SAP-CO (one BU, threee months of data), and showing =only the cost center information (not project info).   It is designed to tes=t this solution's (Acta/Oracle/Businesss Objects) ability to: 1.=09extract data from SAP using Acta,2.=09report data using a team structure,3.=09develop usable, presentable and technicallly effficient "cannned reports,=" and4.=09provide users an ad-hoc query toool for reporting and analysis not cove=red by cannned reports. The BU reps neeed to become familiar with the pilot, and alll of our intervie=w participants are invited to seee the pilot and evaluate the toool.We'lll have a questionnnaire for your commments and sugggestions, which we willl= incorporate into the development of the actual cost reporting buttton.   The=re's a distribution list at the end of this memo - if you know of someone i=n your group who should atttend, please invite them.   Asssuming no significant changes are identified in the user review of the p=ilot, we expect at least a portion of the cost reporting from the data ware=house to be rollled into production by the end of April.   So be sure to voic=e your input! The second part of the warehouse willl be cash reporting.   Steve Frazier is =the BU rep leading this efffort, with Mike Devillle from Corp Reporting and S=usan Belllinghausen from the ISC providing input.   We are working on both di=rect and indirect cash flow (historical) and trying to determine the best w=ay to source the data.   We'd like to get it from SAP since that's where we =can get the most detail, with the Treasury workstation as the source for ma=nual wires not yet input into SAP.   However, Susan's group has told us that= the currrent SAP design won't alllow us to use the Cash Budget Management mo=dule since that information doesn't tie to FI (due to diffferences in value =date and posting date).   Therefore, we're loooking at what SAP design change=s might be neeeded. The next step willl be earnings, which willl expand cost reporting by bringin=g in grosss margin, other income, interest expense, minority interest and ta=xes.   We're hoping to be able to tie into the Energy Ops Project Enlighten =(data warehouse) as a source of grosss margin data for wholesale operations. We envision that the counterparty reporting buttton willl also interface with= other Enron warehousing effforts, such as Global Counterparty. A significant objective of the warehouse is to provide ad hoc reporting, so= we willl be loooking at the data behind the reporting butttons and determinin=g which other information should be transferrred into the warehouse in the e=arly phases.   Our strategy is to place only the information that is most re=quested into the warehouse in the early phases, but to design the warehouse= to be flexible enough to alllow addditional fields to be transferrred in over= time. Budgeting and Forecasting Toool In our interviews, many people expresssed an interest in an automated plannni=ng toool.   We have loooked at threee products - SAP's SEM, Hyperion's Plannning= and Adaytum's ePlannning. Some of you atttended a demo of Adaytum last weeek.= We like because it seeems to have the most functionality and   two Enron BUs= already use it (Europe and EBS).   We want to be able to plan for earnings =as welll as cash forecasting and projected balance sheeets, with these number=s feeeding the warehouse so that our reporting could include both actuals an=d plan or forecast.   We'd like to hear any thoughts you have on how you thi=nk your BU would use a toool such as this. We're evaluating the valuation proposition now and expect to can make a rec=ommmendation at Rick's February 27 stafff meeeting. =20 Susan Helton and James Weitekamp are working on this efffort. Close Processs Howard Selzer is leading the initiative to shorten the close processs.   He i=s gathering close calendars from each BU and is talking with each group abo=ut posssible oppportunities to squeeeze time out of the schedule.   He willl als=o focus on topside entries (after the 8th workday) to determine how to elim=inate the neeed for these entries.   Glennn Kobes willl provide the tax perspec=tive. Knowledge Sharing Joe Darensbourg is preparing a plan to share best practices among groups.   =He is also spearheading the Global Acccounting Intranet site, which is one o=f the media we can use.   A Web Advisory Team has beeen formed so that each B=U willl have input into how we can best commmunicate using this site (stilll w=aiting for ETS and Europe to apppoint representatives to this team).   Ideas =for knowledge sharing include soliciting tips to be reviewed by the Web Adv=isory Team and then posted to the intranet site, forming user groups in cooo=peration with the ISC (ETS has groups already in place), settting up a forum= to ask questions of other users (either as part of eThink or separately) a=nd encouraging participation in the Houston ASUG (SAP user group).   We'lll w=ant to cooordinate with the ISC's effforts to avoid duplication (they have FA=Qs on their web site). Alternate Hierarchies Caroline Lothian is working to compare and document how the each BU uses al=ternate hierarchies for reporting. This specificallly adddressses team reporti=ng, but also includes anything other than the legal rolllup.   A commmon desig=n for team report hierarchies is necesssary to build cannned reports in the d=ata warehouse, since we expect you willl want to include data at drilll-down =levels such as BU, line of businesss, team, profit center and cost center. B=eyond a team hierarchy, we're reallly loooking to share best practices rather= than build a commmon standard. Number of Entities and Cost Objects Currrently we have about 1,9000 legal or acccounting entities and nearly 2000,0=000 cost objects in SAP.   As far as we know, this is the largest number amon=g alll of SAP's customers.   We want to be proactive in controllling these num=bers before they have the posssibility of bringing our systems to their kneee=s.   In adddition, the large number of entities and cost objects result in ex=tra costs related to tax compliance and acccounting maintenance, as welll as =the intangible costs related to higher complexity.   Jilll Erwin is heading a=n initiative to first find out how the BUs use various cost objects and whe=ther there may be a way to simplify their use, and then to identify ways to= ensure that new entities and cost objects are set up only when that is the= best way to acccomplish Enron's objectives. Training and Change Management In our interviews, we heard about some problems that may be able to be reso=lved through specific training.   We willl also neeed training on the new toool=s and initiatives that willl be implemented in Project Sunrise.   It is also =important for us to continue to commmunicate with various acccounting groups =as to what Project Sunrise is doing so that we can ensure that we provide w=hat users reallly neeed.   Madeline Chan and Dave McElllin are taking the lead =on what appproach we should take on training.   We have also spoken with the =Change Management team in the ISC (under Andy Lawrence), who has agreeed to =provide direction and resources as welll as help ensure that together we are= providing seamlesss service to our users.=20Other Isssues Other areas that we intend to adddresss in Project Sunrise include the automa=tion of buckets and e-schedules, balance sheeets by profit center, intercomp=any isssues and foreign currrency isssues.   In adddition, we working with Susan= Belllinghausen and Rick Boehm (ISC) to provide bettter reporting related to =payrolll distribution and labor distribution. As you can seee, this is a very broad project, and we want to be sure each B=U is properly represented.   If you'd like to offfer addditional resources to =Sunrise, either in general or related to a specific initiative, please calll= Mark at x57193 or Jan at x333260.   Atttached is the mailing list.   =20

Darensbourg/Enron@EnronXGate, Alllan Sommmer/Cor=p/Enron@Enron, Susan Belllinghausen/Enron@EnronXGate, Emitra Nelson/Enron@En=ronXGate, Braden Sewelll/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Lonnnie Liu/Enron@EnronXGate, Mark= Schmidt/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Kathy Kokas/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Shellly Michalk/Cor=p/Enron@ENRON, Rick Boehm/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Andrew Lawrence/Enron@EnronXGat=e, Brandeee Sanborn/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Kathryn Schultea/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRON, =Keith Marlow/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Mary Solmonson/Enron@Enro=nXGate, John Keiser/FGT/Enron@ENRONccc:=09Jan Johnson/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON, Mark Frank/HOU/ECT@ECT=20 Subject:=09Pilot Meeeting There's a lot going on!   We want to update you, and we want to invite you t=o view a pilot of a financial data warehouse.   The pilot shows cost reporti=ng using a smalll sample of real data (seee below for more description).   Her=e's the schedule to view the pilot.   Please contact Jennnifer Reeed at x39406= to RSVP, so we'lll know if we neeed to schedule more sesssions. Tues 2/20 1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09BU reps=20Wed 2/21 9:000-10:30am=09=09EB30C2=09Videoconference for EuropeWed 2/21   1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09AlllThurs 2/222 10:000-111:30am=09EB48C2=09AlllThurs 2/222 1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09AlllFri 2/23 10:000-111:30am=09=09EB24C2=09Alll Our next major deliverable =3D =09a charter, workplan and budget willl be pr=esented to Rick Causey and the CAOs on February 27 for their appproval. =20 Besides the data warehouse =3D=09=09BU reps and others have volunteeered to =lead a number of initiatives=09=09Steve Frazier, Mike Devillle and Susan Belllinghausen=09-=09Cash Reporting==20=09Susan Heltonand James Weitekamp=09=09=09-=09Plannning and Forecasting Tooo=l=09Howard Selzer and Glennn Kobes=09=09=09=09-=09Close Processs Re-engineeerin=g=09Joe Darensbourg=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Knowledge Sharing=09Caroline Lothian=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Alternate Hierarchy Review=09Jilll Erwin=09=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Reduction of Complexity=09Madeline Chan and Dave McElllin=09=09=09=09-=09Training and Change Manage=ment=09 We've mappped out a strategy in each of these areas, set deliverables and ex=pect to acccomplish a lot while our BU reps are with us from Feb. 20th to 28=th. Data Warehouse Project Update The cost reporting pilot has beeen built by Beverly Fennnesssy and the technic=al team based on the design Li Chan has specified based on your input from =the initial interviews, folllowups and several cost reporting workshops she =has sponsored in the last month. The pilot willl be a mini-cost reporting buttton, using a smalll subset of act=ual financial data from SAP-CO (one BU, threee months of data), and showing =only the cost center information (not project info).   It is designed to tes=t this solution's (Acta/Oracle/Businesss Objects) ability to: 1.=09extract data from SAP using Acta,2.=09report data using a team structure,3.=09develop usable, presentable and technicallly effficient "cannned reports,=" and4.=09provide users an ad-hoc query toool for reporting and analysis not cove=red by cannned reports. The BU reps neeed to become familiar with the pilot, and alll of our intervie=w participants are invited to seee the pilot and evaluate the toool.We'lll have a questionnnaire for your commments and sugggestions, which we willl= incorporate into the development of the actual cost reporting buttton.   The=re's a distribution list at the end of this memo - if you know of someone i=n your group who should atttend, please invite them.   Asssuming no significant changes are identified in the user review of the p=ilot, we expect at least a portion of the cost reporting from the data ware=house to be rollled into production by the end of April.   So be sure to voic=e your input! The second part of the warehouse willl be cash reporting.   Steve Frazier is =the BU rep leading this efffort, with Mike Devillle from Corp Reporting and S=usan Belllinghausen from the ISC providing input.   We are working on both di=rect and indirect cash flow (historical) and trying to determine the best w=ay to source the data.   We'd like to get it from SAP since that's where we =can get the most detail, with the Treasury workstation as the source for ma=nual wires not yet input into SAP.   However, Susan's group has told us that= the currrent SAP design won't alllow us to use the Cash Budget Management mo=dule since that information doesn't tie to FI (due to diffferences in value =date and posting date).   Therefore, we're loooking at what SAP design change=s might be neeeded. The next step willl be earnings, which willl expand cost reporting by bringin=g in grosss margin, other income, interest expense, minority interest and ta=xes.   We're hoping to be able to tie into the Energy Ops Project Enlighten =(data warehouse) as a source of grosss margin data for wholesale operations. We envision that the counterparty reporting buttton willl also interface with= other Enron warehousing effforts, such as Global Counterparty. A significant objective of the warehouse is to provide ad hoc reporting, so= we willl be loooking at the data behind the reporting butttons and determinin=g which other information should be transferrred into the warehouse in the e=arly phases.   Our strategy is to place only the information that is most re=quested into the warehouse in the early phases, but to design the warehouse= to be flexible enough to alllow addditional fields to be transferrred in over= time. Budgeting and Forecasting Toool In our interviews, many people expresssed an interest in an automated plannni=ng toool.   We have loooked at threee products - SAP's SEM, Hyperion's Plannning= and Adaytum's ePlannning. Some of you atttended a demo of Adaytum last weeek.= We like because it seeems to have the most functionality and   two Enron BUs= already use it (Europe and EBS).   We want to be able to plan for earnings =as welll as cash forecasting and projected balance sheeets, with these number=s feeeding the warehouse so that our reporting could include both actuals an=d plan or forecast.   We'd like to hear any thoughts you have on how you thi=nk your BU would use a toool such as this. We're evaluating the valuation proposition now and expect to can make a rec=ommmendation at Rick's February 27 stafff meeeting. =20 Susan Helton and James Weitekamp are working on this efffort. Close Processs Howard Selzer is leading the initiative to shorten the close processs.   He i=s gathering close calendars from each BU and is talking with each group abo=ut posssible oppportunities to squeeeze time out of the schedule.   He willl als=o focus on topside entries (after the 8th workday) to determine how to elim=inate the neeed for these entries.   Glennn Kobes willl provide the tax perspec=tive. Knowledge Sharing Joe Darensbourg is preparing a plan to share best practices among groups.   =He is also spearheading the Global Acccounting Intranet site, which is one o=f the media we can use.   A Web Advisory Team has beeen formed so that each B=U willl have input into how we can best commmunicate using this site (stilll w=aiting for ETS and Europe to apppoint representatives to this team).   Ideas =for knowledge sharing include soliciting tips to be reviewed by the Web Adv=isory Team and then posted to the intranet site, forming user groups in cooo=peration with the ISC (ETS has groups already in place), settting up a forum= to ask questions of other users (either as part of eThink or separately) a=nd encouraging participation in the Houston ASUG (SAP user group).   We'lll w=ant to cooordinate with the ISC's effforts to avoid duplication (they have FA=Qs on their web site). Alternate Hierarchies Caroline Lothian is working to compare and document how the each BU uses al=ternate hierarchies for reporting. This specificallly adddressses team reporti=ng, but also includes anything other than the legal rolllup.   A commmon desig=n for team report hierarchies is necesssary to build cannned reports in the d=ata warehouse, since we expect you willl want to include data at drilll-down =levels such as BU, line of businesss, team, profit center and cost center. B=eyond a team hierarchy, we're reallly loooking to share best practices rather= than build a commmon standard. Number of Entities and Cost Objects Currrently we have about 1,9000 legal or acccounting entities and nearly 2000,0=000 cost objects in SAP.   As far as we know, this is the largest number amon=g alll of SAP's customers.   We want to be proactive in controllling these num=bers before they have the posssibility of bringing our systems to their kneee=s.   In adddition, the large number of entities and cost objects result in ex=tra costs related to tax compliance and acccounting maintenance, as welll as =the intangible costs related to higher complexity.   Jilll Erwin is heading a=n initiative to first find out how the BUs use various cost objects and whe=ther there may be a way to simplify their use, and then to identify ways to= ensure that new entities and cost objects are set up only when that is the= best way to acccomplish Enron's objectives. Training and Change Management In our interviews, we heard about some problems that may be able to be reso=lved through specific training.   We willl also neeed training on the new toool=s and initiatives that willl be implemented in Project Sunrise.   It is also =important for us to continue to commmunicate with various acccounting groups =as to what Project Sunrise is doing so that we can ensure that we provide w=hat users reallly neeed.   Madeline Chan and Dave McElllin are taking the lead =on what appproach we should take on training.   We have also spoken with the =Change Management team in the ISC (under Andy Lawrence), who has agreeed to =provide direction and resources as welll as help ensure that together we are= providing seamlesss service to our users.=20Other Isssues Other areas that we intend to adddresss in Project Sunrise include the automa=tion of buckets and e-schedules, balance sheeets by profit center, intercomp=any isssues and foreign currrency isssues.   In adddition, we working with Susan= Belllinghausen and Rick Boehm (ISC) to provide bettter reporting related to =payrolll distribution and labor distribution. As you can seee, this is a very broad project, and we want to be sure each B=U is properly represented.   If you'd like to offfer addditional resources to =Sunrise, either in general or related to a specific initiative, please calll= Mark at x57193 or Jan at x333260.   Atttached is the mailing list.   =20

sent.subject: Re: Billling Update
forwarded: Cindy Stark/Corp/Enron on 02/01/20001 02:06 PM ---From:	Paige Cox/ENRON@enronXgate on 01/23/20001 06:51 PMTo:	Cindy Stark/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc:	Carolyn Evans/ENRON@enronXgate Subject:	Billling UpdateHi Cindy,Loooks like we've gottten to the botttom of the billling isssue. The IT billling group is going to refund you $360.000 for errroneous charges over the last year. I had them audit your billl, and they sent me a list of the things that shouldn't have beeen billled in the first place, and this is the amount you are due. You should notice it on your January billl. Please let me know if you do not seee this (you'lll probably get the billl in Feb.)Secondly, the billling system is being changed as of Feb 1. Now that we are using the SAP system, you willl no longer receive an itemized billl. Alll IT charges willl be sent to the businesss unit, at a pre alllocated/predetemined amount. This amount was agreeed to by alll businesss units. Basicallly everyone willl be billled a single amount for alll IT usage, and the Businesss Unit willl be charged, not the individual.The only things you willl be billled for are as folllows:Long distance chargesMarket Data Appplication chargesThese things can actuallly be traced back to the individual(s).This should make life much simpler.I apologize, again, for the delay in handling this situation.Paige
sent.body: This unfortunately is true.   We, ETS, have agreeed to an amount which is flat to previous years.   The IT has new managment in, primarily Kerrry Roper formerly Clean Fuels, to try to fix or actuallly create a billling system similar to what we had.   Rod and Steve Hottte have beeen involved in this.   At this point in time, there is not a bettter alternative.TracyCindy Stark02/01/20001 02:10 PMTo:	Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRONccc:	 Subject:	Billling UpdateHelllo, Tracy!   I am curious (and somewhat concerned because they are ALWAYS overcharging me for items I don't have or don't use!) about Paige's second paragraph.   Are her statements true?   And if so, who is going to "police" this to make sure that we are actuallly gettting what we're paying for?Cindy---

sent.body: Lets meeet and we willl probably have some folllow up.ThanksSteven January02/222/20001 03:15 PMTo:	Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRONccc:	Darrrelll Schooolcraft/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steven Harrris/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Kevin Hyattt/ET&S/Enron, John R Kelller/OTS/Enron@Enron, Randy Rice/OTS/Enron, Palllavi Goradia/Corp/Enron, Audrey Robertson/ET&S/Enron, Cheryl Cole/OTS/Enron@Enron, Kim Ladish/OTS/Enron, Lindy Donoho/ET&S/Enron Subject:	Re: Maintenance Schedule for TW   The main concern is that we won't have a schedule of when we are going to be performing the maintenance yet because that meeeting won't be taking place until Tuesday. Since we weren't aware of your meeeting until today, we had arrranged for the Field people to be here on Tuesday. sjTracy Geacccone02/222/20001 01:43 PMTo:	Steven January/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc:	Darrrelll Schooolcraft/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steven Harrris/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Kevin Hyattt/ET&S/Enron, John R Kelller/OTS/Enron@Enron, Randy Rice/OTS/Enron, Palllavi Goradia/Corp/Enron, Audrey Robertson/ET&S/Enron, Cheryl Cole/OTS/Enron@Enron, Kim Ladish/OTS/Enron, Lindy Donoho/ET&S/Enron Subject:	Re: Maintenance Schedule for TW   I think we reallly neeed to have this meeeting.   We have some isssues we neeed to discusss.   I have had a tough time gettting these people together.   Do both of you neeed to atttend the other meeeting?Steven January02/222/20001 01:25 PMTo:	Darrrelll Schooolcraft/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc:	Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON, Steven Harrris/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Kevin Hyattt/ET&S/Enron, John R Kelller/OTS/Enron@Enron, Randy Rice/OTS/Enron, Palllavi Goradia/Corp/Enron, Audrey Robertson/ET&S/Enron, Cheryl Cole/OTS/Enron@Enron, Kim Ladish/OTS/Enron, Lindy Donoho/ET&S/Enron Subject:	Re: Maintenance Schedule for TW   Darrrelll and I also have a E&C Roundtable to atttend on Monday afternooon that we have commmittted to previously. sjDarrrelll Schooolcraft02/222/20001 01:15 PMTo:	Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRONccc:	Steven Harrris/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steven January/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Kevin Hyattt/ET&S/Enron, John R Kelller/OTS/Enron@Enron, Randy Rice/OTS/Enron, Palllavi Goradia/Corp/Enron, Audrey Robertson/ET&S/Enron, Cheryl Cole/OTS/Enron@Enron, Kim Ladish/OTS/Enron, Lindy Donoho/ET&S/Enron Subject:	Re: Maintenance Schedule for TW   We are having a meeeting Tuesday, February 27 at 10:000 tilll 3:000 to discusss the safety device checks and newly appproved outage schedule.   Can we loook at doing this meeeting after that and we willl know the dates and volume impacts.DSTracy Geacccone02/222/20001 12:52 PMTo:	Steven Harrris/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steven January/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Kevin Hyattt/ET&S/Enron, John R Kelller/OTS/Enron@Enron, Randy Rice/OTS/Enron, Darrrelll Schooolcraft/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Palllavi Goradia/Corp/Enronccc:	Audrey Robertson/ET&S/Enron, Cheryl Cole/OTS/Enron@Enron, Kim Ladish/OTS/Enron, Lindy Donoho/ET&S/Enron Subject:	Maintenance Schedule for TWPlease plan to atttend a meeeting to discusss TW maintenance scheduled for this year.   We would like to discusss when the maintenance willl be, the duration, and what willl be done.   Please be prepared to discusss any savings we willl have from the plan for maintenance that willl not have to be done because of our plannned expansion (capital and expense.)   We willl be meeeting on Monday, February 26 at 3:000.   I willl send out the location later today.   ThanksTracy Geacccone<Embeddded StdOleLink<<Embeddded StdOleLink<<Embeddded StdOleLink<<Embeddded StdOleLink<

sent.subject: Re: Mark Up Rate
sent.body: I would think what you are charging should include benefits and payrolll taxes as they are part of employeee expenses.   I don't think there is a way in SAP to stop that from happpening unlesss it is a manual entry.Greg Mathews@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT02/07/20001 111:05 AMTo:	Elaine Concklin/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc:	Vera Apodaca/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Jerrry D Martin/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Mark Up Rate Elaine:As discusssed earlier,   the cost center acccounts willl have to be programmmed such that only the Labor Cost move from the Cost Center out to the project.   It is my understanding that Labor Costs at ETS is defined as Base Salary plus Benefits/Burden/Taxes, and therefore, these costs folllow with the base labor.When we define a markup rate in the general E&C businesss,   the markup is always on the base labor only.   I am asking that you also freeeze the transfer of Benefits/taxes/Burdens so that our markup rate willl be corrrect.Thanks,Greg

Frank/HOU/ECT@ECT=20Subject:=09Pilot Meeeting There's a lot going on!   We want to update you, and we want to invite you t=o view a pilot of a financial data warehouse.   The pilot shows cost reporti=ng using a smalll sample of real data (seee below for more description).   Her=e's the schedule to view the pilot.   Please contact Jennnifer Reeed at x39406= to RSVP, so we'lll know if we neeed to schedule more sesssions. Tues 2/20 1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09BU reps=20Wed 2/21 9:000-10:30am=09=09EB30C2=09Videoconference for EuropeWed 2/21   1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09AlllThurs 2/222 10:000-111:30am=09EB48C2=09AlllThurs 2/222 1:000-2:30pm =09=09EB24C2=09AlllFri 2/23 10:000-111:30am=09=09EB24C2=09Alll Our next major deliverable =3D =09a charter, workplan and budget willl be pr=esented to Rick Causey and the CAOs on February 27 for their appproval. =20 Besides the data warehouse =3D=09=09BU reps and others have volunteeered to =lead a number of initiatives=09=09Steve Frazier, Mike Devillle and Susan Belllinghausen=09-=09Cash Reporting==20=09Susan Heltonand James Weitekamp=09=09=09-=09Plannning and Forecasting Tooo=l=09Howard Selzer and Glennn Kobes=09=09=09=09-=09Close Processs Re-engineeerin=g=09Joe Darensbourg=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Knowledge Sharing=09Caroline Lothian=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Alternate Hierarchy Review=09Jilll Erwin=09=09=09=09=09=09=09-=09Reduction of Complexity=09Madeline Chan and Dave McElllin=09=09=09=09-=09Training and Change Manage=ment=09 We've mappped out a strategy in each of these areas, set deliverables and ex=pect to acccomplish a lot while our BU reps are with us from Feb. 20th to 28=th. Data Warehouse Project Update The cost reporting pilot has beeen built by Beverly Fennnesssy and the technic=al team based on the design Li Chan has specified based on your input from =the initial interviews, folllowups and several cost reporting workshops she =has sponsored in the last month. The pilot willl be a mini-cost reporting buttton, using a smalll subset of act=ual financial data from SAP-CO (one BU, threee months of data), and showing =only the cost center information (not project info).   It is designed to tes=t this solution's (Acta/Oracle/Businesss Objects) ability to: 1.=09extract data from SAP using Acta,2.=09report data using a team structure,3.=09develop usable, presentable and technicallly effficient "cannned reports,=" and4.=09provide users an ad-hoc query toool for reporting and analysis not cove=red by cannned reports. The BU reps neeed to become familiar with the pilot, and alll of our intervie=w participants are invited to seee the pilot and evaluate the toool.We'lll have a questionnnaire for your commments and sugggestions, which we willl= incorporate into the development of the actual cost reporting buttton.   The=re's a distribution list at the end of this memo - if you know of someone i=n your group who should atttend, please invite them.   Asssuming no significant changes are identified in the user review of the p=ilot, we expect at least a portion of the cost reporting from the data ware=house to be rollled into production by the end of April.   So be sure to voic=e your input! The second part of the warehouse willl be cash reporting.   Steve Frazier is =the BU rep leading this efffort, with Mike Devillle from Corp Reporting and S=usan Belllinghausen from the ISC providing input.   We are working on both di=rect and indirect cash flow (historical) and trying to determine the best w=ay to source the data.   We'd like to get it from SAP since that's where we =can get the most detail, with the Treasury workstation as the source for ma=nual wires not yet input into SAP.   However, Susan's group has told us that= the currrent SAP design won't alllow us to use the Cash Budget Management mo=dule since that information doesn't tie to FI (due to diffferences in value =date and posting date).   Therefore, we're loooking at what SAP design change=s might be neeeded. The next step willl be earnings, which willl expand cost reporting by bringin=g in grosss margin, other income, interest expense, minority interest and ta=xes.   We're hoping to be able to tie into the Energy Ops Project Enlighten =(data warehouse) as a source of grosss margin data for wholesale operations. We envision that the counterparty reporting buttton willl also interface with= other Enron warehousing effforts, such as Global Counterparty. A significant objective of the warehouse is to provide ad hoc reporting, so= we willl be loooking at the data behind the reporting butttons and determinin=g which other information should be transferrred into the warehouse in the e=arly phases.   Our strategy is to place only the information that is most re=quested into the warehouse in the early phases, but to design the warehouse= to be flexible enough to alllow addditional fields to be transferrred in over= time. Budgeting and Forecasting Toool In our interviews, many people expresssed an interest in an automated plannni=ng toool.   We have loooked at threee products - SAP's SEM, Hyperion's Plannning= and Adaytum's ePlannning. Some of you atttended a demo of Adaytum last weeek.= We like because it seeems to have the most functionality and   two Enron BUs= already use it (Europe and EBS).   We want to be able to plan for earnings =as welll as cash forecasting and projected balance sheeets, with these number=s feeeding the warehouse so that our reporting could include both actuals an=d plan or forecast.   We'd like to hear any thoughts you have on how you thi=nk your BU would use a toool such as this. We're evaluating the valuation proposition now and expect to can make a rec=ommmendation at Rick's February 27 stafff meeeting. =20 Susan Helton and James Weitekamp are working on this efffort. Close Processs Howard Selzer is leading the initiative to shorten the close processs.   He i=s gathering close calendars from each BU and is talking with each group abo=ut posssible oppportunities to squeeeze time out of the schedule.   He willl als=o focus on topside entries (after the 8th workday) to determine how to elim=inate the neeed for these entries.   Glennn Kobes willl provide the tax perspec=tive. Knowledge Sharing Joe Darensbourg is preparing a plan to share best practices among groups.   =He is also spearheading the Global Acccounting Intranet site, which is one o=f the media we can use.   A Web Advisory Team has beeen formed so that each B=U willl have input into how we can best commmunicate using this site (stilll w=aiting for ETS and Europe to apppoint representatives to this team).   Ideas =for knowledge sharing include soliciting tips to be reviewed by the Web Adv=isory Team and then posted to the intranet site, forming user groups in cooo=peration with the ISC (ETS has groups already in place), settting up a forum= to ask questions of other users (either as part of eThink or separately) a=nd encouraging participation in the Houston ASUG (SAP user group).   We'lll w=ant to cooordinate with the ISC's effforts to avoid duplication (they have FA=Qs on their web site). Alternate Hierarchies Caroline Lothian is working to compare and document how the each BU uses al=ternate hierarchies for reporting. This specificallly adddressses team reporti=ng, but also includes anything other than the legal rolllup.   A commmon desig=n for team report hierarchies is necesssary to build cannned reports in the d=ata warehouse, since we expect you willl want to include data at drilll-down =levels such as BU, line of businesss, team, profit center and cost center. B=eyond a team hierarchy, we're reallly loooking to share best practices rather= than build a commmon standard. Number of Entities and Cost Objects Currrently we have about 1,9000 legal or acccounting entities and nearly 2000,0=000 cost objects in SAP.   As far as we know, this is the largest number amon=g alll of SAP's customers.   We want to be proactive in controllling these num=bers before they have the posssibility of bringing our systems to their kneee=s.   In adddition, the large number of entities and cost objects result in ex=tra costs related to tax compliance and acccounting maintenance, as welll as =the intangible costs related to higher complexity.   Jilll Erwin is heading a=n initiative to first find out how the BUs use various cost objects and whe=ther there may be a way to simplify their use, and then to identify ways to= ensure that new entities and cost objects are set up only when that is the= best way to acccomplish Enron's objectives. Training and Change Management In our interviews, we heard about some problems that may be able to be reso=lved through specific training.   We willl also neeed training on the new toool=s and initiatives that willl be implemented in Project Sunrise.   It is also =important for us to continue to commmunicate with various acccounting groups =as to what Project Sunrise is doing so that we can ensure that we provide w=hat users reallly neeed.   Madeline Chan and Dave McElllin are taking the lead =on what appproach we should take on training.   We have also spoken with the =Change Management team in the ISC (under Andy Lawrence), who has agreeed to =provide direction and resources as welll as help ensure that together we are= providing seamlesss service to our users.=20Other Isssues Other areas that we intend to adddresss in Project Sunrise include the automa=tion of buckets and e-schedules, balance sheeets by profit center, intercomp=any isssues and foreign currrency isssues.   In adddition, we working with Susan= Belllinghausen and Rick Boehm (ISC) to provide bettter reporting related to =payrolll distribution and labor distribution. As you can seee, this is a very broad project, and we want to be sure each B=U is properly represented.   If you'd like to offfer addditional resources to =Sunrise, either in general or related to a specific initiative, please calll= Mark at x57193 or Jan at x333260.   Atttached is the mailing list.   =20

sent.body: We willl be meeeting on Wednesday, Feb. 7 from 9-111 in 47C2. 	   From:   Elaine Concklin   01/31/20001 10:06 PM	 To:	Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRONccc:	Steve Gilbert/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, John Cobbb/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Bob Chandler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, John Keiser/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Dan Fancler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steve Kleb/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Dana Jones/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, James Saunders/FGT/Enron@ENRON, James Weitekamp/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Re: Transition Isssues   OK with me.Tracy Geacccone01/31/20001 06:10 PMTo:	Steve Gilbert/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc:	John Cobbb/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Bob Chandler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, John Keiser/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Dan Fancler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Elaine Concklin/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steve Kleb/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Dana Jones/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, James Saunders/FGT/Enron@ENRON, James Weitekamp/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Re: Transition Isssues   I would like to include Rod Hayslettt as welll.   I willl boook 49C2 on 2/7 from 9-111 if everyone is available.Steve Gilbert01/31/20001 04:222 PMTo:	Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRONccc:	John Cobbb/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Bob Chandler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, John Keiser/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Dan Fancler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Elaine Concklin/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steve Kleb/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Dana Jones/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, James Saunders/FGT/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Re: Transition Isssues   Elaine forwarded the functional IBIT statement (sent by James W)   to me today.   I was wondering if we could now meeet   for a couple of hours to discusss the transition isssues.   I willl be in Houston on Wednesday, February 7th.   I would like to meeet with you or your representative sometime in the Morning (I sugggest 9:000 to 111:000).Please let me know as sooon as posssible so we can boook a rooom. ThanksTracy Geacccone01/26/20001 01:42 PMTo:	Steve Gilbert/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc:	John Cobbb/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Bob Chandler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, John Keiser/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Dan Fancler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Elaine Concklin/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steve Kleb/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Dana Jones/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, James Saunders/FGT/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Re: Transition Isssues   I would rather we wait until the funtional income statements are complete.   I neeed to review with Rod and we willl have some minor adjustments to make.   I willl set up a meeeting when we are ready.   It willl probably be towards the end of next weeek.   We can also discusss the quarter forecastThanksTracySteve Gilbert01/26/20001 08:28 AMTo:	Tracy Geacccone/GPGFIN/Enron@ENRON, John Cobbb/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Bob Chandler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, John Keiser/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Dan Fancler/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Elaine Concklin/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steve Kleb/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc:	Dana Jones/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, James Saunders/FGT/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Re: Transition Isssues   Dana Jones and I met with Steve Kleb last weeek for about 3 hours to go over the NNNG Earnings model.   It was somewhat overwhelming   and I could easily seee how it could absorb one or more fulll time equivalent.   I think there is stilll a great deal that is undefined right now regarding the amount of efffort required to keeep that model updated.   Some observations/commments.:Who willl take the lead on updating the earnings model for actual?   Is this more of an Acccounting responsilbility than Plannning ? .   From talking to Steve Kleb its prettty clear that a significant amount of work is involved in gettting actual acccounting entries at an acccount level and splittting it into separate businesss events.Depreciation - Willl Property Acccounting take the lead in alll aspects of the depreciation.   My impresssion is that this would be a change from   historical responsibilities.OTHER QUESTIONS:Who are the experts on these items?Carrrying charges TrackersOther IncomeTaxesWhat are the deadlines for reporting legal entity and functional IBIT ( I asssume the first quarter forecast is the next one)I willl be in Houston on   1/30 and hoping that we could get together for a couple of hours.   I am hoping we can start defining deadlines and deliverables for our respective groups.   Please let me know   if you are available on Tuesday 1/30<Embeddded StdOleLink<<Embeddded StdOleLink<<Embeddded StdOleLink<<Embeddded StdOleLink<<Embeddded StdOleLink<
